oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Thompson Show (XELO) - Series 1, Program 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Hank Thompson radio show to promote his songbook on XELO, Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico; advertised as and with a mailing address of Clint, Texas. Labelled as series 1, program 5. Likely original broadcast date of 1950-03-31 (unconfirmed). Backed by his Brazos Valley Boys of Wade Wood on fiddle (mentioned), Lefty Nason on steel guitar (mentioned), Billy Stewart on bass (presumably, not mentioned), and joined by The Delmore Brothers (Alton Delmore and Rabon Delmore) for 'Blues Stay Away From Me'. Announcer at beginning referred to as Cousin Abner.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer opening statement (Cousin Abner) -- Theme (Humpty Dumpty Heart) -- I Gotta Have My Baby Back -- Hank Thompson talks about his songbook -- Sally Gooden (Wade Wood fiddle) -- Don't Flirt With Me -- Hank Thompson introduces the Delmore Brothers -- Blues Stay Away From Me (The Delmore Brothers vocals) -- Announcer talks about the Hank Thompson songbook -- Paradise Isle (Lefty Nason steel guitar) -- I Am A Pilgrim -- Closing statement -- Theme (Humpty Dumpty Heart)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: XELO (Radio station : Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico); Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Nason, Lefty; Wood, Wade; Stewart, Billy (Bassist); Delmore Brothers; Delmore, Alton; Delmore, Rabon, 1916-1952
